events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on March 30th, providing initial details about the accident and damages.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under auto accident due to the involvement of a vehicle collision on public roads.
An agent specialized in auto claims was assigned to handle the case promptly and ensure a smooth claims process.
The insured was contacted to acknowledge receipt of the claim and provide information about next steps in the investigation.
Requested photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and repair estimates from the customer to assess the claim properly.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed repair quotes and the official police accident report.
Started investigation into the collision details, including verification of accident location and involved parties' statements.
The investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and the extent of damage was confirmed as claimed.
A settlement amount covering full repair costs and associated fees was proposed to the insured for approval.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and requested expedited payment for repairs.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager following customer agreement to the settlement terms.
Payment was processed and issued to the customer's designated account to cover the approved repair expenses.
The claim was closed after confirmation that repairs were completed and the customer was satisfied with the resolution.
All case files and correspondence were archived securely for future reference according to company policy.
